quests.desc: Welcome to TextWorld! Here is how to play! Your first objective is to open the chest drawer. And then, retrieve the old key from the chest drawer in the bedroom. And then, make sure that the wooden door in the bedroom is unlocked with the old key. If you have unlocked the wooden door, doublecheck that the wooden door inside the bedroom is wide open. And then, attempt to go east. Then, make sure that the screen door within the kitchen is opened. Alright, thanks!

commands: take old key from chest drawer
unlock wooden door with old key

infos.name: kitchen
infos.desc:
You are in a kitchen. A standard kind of place.

 Were you looking for a refrigerator? Because look over there, it's a refrigerator. Huh, weird.[if c_2 is open and there is something in the c_2] The refrigerator contains [a list of things in the c_2]. You idly wonder how they came up with the name TextWorld for this place. It's pretty fitting.[end if][if c_2 is open and the c_2 contains nothing] The refrigerator is empty, what a horrible day![end if] Look over there! a counter. [if there is something on the s_1]You see [a list of things on the s_1] on the counter.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_1]But the thing is empty, unfortunately.[end if] You can make out a kitchen island. [if there is something on the s_2]You see [a list of things on the s_2] on the kitchen island.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_2]But the thing is empty, unfortunately. You move on, clearly upset with your TextWorld experience.[end if] You can see a stove. [if there is something on the stove_0]On the stove you can see [a list of things on the stove_0]. There's something strange about this thing being here, but you don't have time to worry about that now.[end if][if there is nothing on the stove_0]But there isn't a thing on it.[end if]

 There is [if d_1 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] screen door leading east. There is [if d_0 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] wooden door leading west. You need an unguarded exit? You should try going north. You don't like doors? Why not try going south, that entranceway is unguarded.

infos.name: bedroom
infos.desc:
I am sorry to announce that you are now in the bedroom.

 You make out a chest drawer.[if c_0 is open and there is something in the c_0] The chest drawer contains [a list of things in the c_0].[end if][if c_0 is open and the c_0 contains nothing] What a letdown! The chest drawer is empty![end if] [if c_1 is locked]A locked[else if c_1 is open]An open[otherwise]A closed[end if] antique trunk, which looks usual, is in the room.[if c_1 is open and there is something in the c_1] The antique trunk contains [a list of things in the c_1]. Suddenly, you bump your head on the ceiling, but it's not such a bad bump that it's going to prevent you from looking at objects and even things.[end if][if c_1 is open and the c_1 contains nothing] What a letdown! The antique trunk is empty![end if] You can make out a king-size bed. [if there is something on the s_0]On the king-size bed you can see [a list of things on the s_0]. Suddenly, you bump your head on the ceiling, but it's not such a bad bump that it's going to prevent you from looking at objects and even things.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_0]But oh no! there's nothing on this piece of junk. Hm. Oh well[end if]

 There is [if d_0 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] wooden door leading east.

infos.name: backyard
infos.desc:
You're now in the backyard. You can barely contain your excitement.

 You make out a bbq. [if there is something on the s_7]You see [a list of things on the s_7] on the bbq. It doesn't get more TextWorld than this![end if][if there is nothing on the s_7]The bbq appears to be empty. What, you think everything in TextWorld should have stuff on it?[end if] You see a patio table. [if there is something on the s_8]On the patio table you see [a list of things on the s_8].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_8]The patio table appears to be empty. Oh! Why couldn't there just be stuff on it?[end if] You make out a set of chairs. [if there is something on the s_9]You see [a list of things on the s_9] on the set of chairs.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_9]But the thing is empty.[end if]

 There is [if d_1 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] screen door leading west. You need an unguarded exit? You should try going south.

infos.name: living room
infos.desc:
You've just sauntered into a living room. The room seems oddly familiar, as though it were only superficially different from the other rooms in the building.

 You scan the room for a couch, and you find a couch. You wonder idly who left that here. The couch is typical.[if there is something on the s_4] On the couch you can see [a list of things on the s_4], so there's that.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_4] Unfortunately, there isn't a thing on it.[end if] You make out a low table. [if there is something on the s_5]You see [a list of things on the s_5] on the low table.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_5]But the thing is empty. Oh! Why couldn't there just be stuff on it?[end if] You make out a tv. The tv is normal.[if there is something on the s_6] On the tv you can make out [a list of things on the s_6].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_6] But the thing is empty. You swear loudly.[end if]

There is an exit to the north. Don't worry, it is unguarded.

infos.name: bathroom
infos.desc:
You arrive in a bathroom. A typical one. You begin looking for stuff.

 You can make out a toilet. You idly wonder how they came up with the name TextWorld for this place. It's pretty fitting.[if c_3 is open and there is something in the c_3] The toilet contains [a list of things in the c_3].[end if][if c_3 is open and the c_3 contains nothing] Empty! What kind of nightmare TextWorld is this?[end if] You can see [if c_4 is locked]a locked[else if c_4 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] bath.[if c_4 is open and there is something in the c_4] The bath contains [a list of things in the c_4]. A bath... Is that really what you were looking for?[end if][if c_4 is open and the c_4 contains nothing] What a letdown! The bath is empty![end if] You see a sink. The sink is usual.[if there is something on the s_3] On the sink you can make out [a list of things on the s_3]. Huh, weird.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_3] But the thing is empty, unfortunately.[end if]

You need an unblocked exit? You should try going south.

infos.name: garden
infos.desc:
You find yourself in a garden. A standard one. You begin to take stock of what's in the room.



There is an exit to the north. Don't worry, it is unguarded.

infos.name: wooden door
infos.desc: it's a commanding wooden door [if open]You can see inside it.[else if closed]You can't see inside it because the lid's in your way.[otherwise]There is a lock on it.[end if]

infos.desc: it's a manageable screen door [if open]You can see inside it.[else if closed]You can't see inside it because the lid's in your way.[otherwise]There is a lock on it.[end if]

infos.name: chest drawer
infos.desc: The chest drawer looks strong, and impossible to force open. [if open]It is open.[else if closed]It is closed.[otherwise]It is locked.[end if]

infos.name: antique trunk
infos.desc: The antique trunk looks strong, and impossible to force open. [if open]You can see inside it.[else if closed]You can't see inside it because the lid's in your way.[otherwise]There is a lock on it.[end if]

infos.desc: The refrigerator looks strong, and impossible to open. [if open]It is open.[else if closed]It is closed.[otherwise]It is locked.[end if]

infos.name: toilet
infos.desc: The toilet looks strong, and impossible to open. [if open]It is open.[else if closed]It is closed.[otherwise]It is locked.[end if]

infos.name: bath
infos.desc: The bath looks strong, and impossible to break open. [if open]It is open.[else if closed]It is closed.[otherwise]It is locked.[end if]

infos.desc: that's an usual tomato plant!

infos.desc: The shovel appears well matched to everything else here

infos.desc: The king-size bed is solid.

infos.desc: The kitchen island is solid.

infos.desc: The sink is shaky.

infos.desc: The tv is wobbly.

infos.desc: The bbq is balanced.

infos.desc: The patio table is solidly built.

infos.desc: The apple looks inviting.

infos.desc: that's a normal milk!

infos.desc: The half of a bag of chips looks appealing.

infos.desc: The old key looks useful

infos.desc: The soap bar is modern.

infos.name: note
infos.desc: The dinner is almost ready! It's only missing a grilled carrot.

infos.desc: The toothbrush is brand new.

infos.desc: The remote is antiquated.

objective: Hey, thanks for coming over to the TextWorld today, there is something I need you to do for me. First thing I need you to do is to assure that the chest drawer is open. And then, take the old key from the chest drawer. And then, check that the wooden door is unlocked with the old key. Then, ensure that the wooden door is open. And then, make an effort to move east. If you can finish that, open the screen door inside the kitchen. Alright, thanks!

main_quest.desc: Hey, thanks for coming over to the TextWorld today, there is something I need you to do for me. First thing I need you to do is to assure that the chest drawer is open. And then, take the old key from the chest drawer. And then, check that the wooden door is unlocked with the old key. Then, ensure that the wooden door is open. And then, make an effort to move east. If you can finish that, open the screen door inside the kitchen. Alright, thanks!
commands: take old key from chest drawer
unlock wooden door with old key
